B. sheet music - Notes on sheet music are specifically designed to be read by musicians. They are not intended to be "hard to read," as their clarity is crucial for playing the music correctly.

C. desk - Desks often have notes, especially in an office or study setting. While some notes might be hastily written and less legible, they are generally meant to be readable.

D. bed - Beds are less likely places for notes unless they are bedside tables where someone might leave a note. Even then, the context doesn't necessarily imply that the note would be hard to read.

E. medical chart - Medical charts can contain a lot of technical information and abbreviations that might be hard to understand for someone without medical training. Additionally, handwritten notes on medical charts can sometimes be difficult to read due to the speed at which they are written during patient examinations.
